title: Retro Cocktails & Drinks
description: Remember the drinks that defined cocktail hour and social gatherings from the 1940s through the 1980s?

questions.question: Which cocktail, made with vodka, coffee liqueur, and cream, became hugely popular in the 1970s and 1980s?
questions.explanation: The White Russian surged in popularity during the 1970s and 1980s. It later had a resurgence thanks to the 1998 film 'The Big Lebowski.'

questions.question: What was the name of the popular powdered drink mix that astronaut John Glenn took into space in 1962?
questions.explanation: Tang was carried aboard Friendship 7 by John Glenn in 1962. Though it existed before the space program, NASA's use made it a household name.

questions.question: Which classic cocktail, popular in the 1950s, combines bourbon, sugar, mint, and crushed ice?
questions.explanation: The Mint Julep, while dating back much earlier, was a hugely popular cocktail in the 1950s and is forever associated with the Kentucky Derby.

questions.question: What colorful layered drink, served in a tall glass, became a tiki bar sensation in the 1960s?
questions.explanation: The Mai Tai was already popular but became a tiki bar sensation in the 1960s during the peak of America's Polynesian restaurant craze.

questions.question: Which non-alcoholic drink brand introduced its iconic 'plop plop, fizz fizz' jingle in 1976?
questions.explanation: Alka-Seltzer's famous 'Plop, plop, fizz, fizz, oh what a relief it is' jingle debuted in 1976 and became one of the most memorable advertising slogans ever.

questions.question: What was Harvey Wallbanger, the trendy 1970s cocktail, made with?
questions.explanation: The Harvey Wallbanger was made with vodka, fresh orange juice, and Galliano liqueur. It was one of the most popular cocktails of the 1970s.

questions.question: Which soft drink was originally marketed as 'Brad's Drink' when it was created in 1893?
questions.explanation: Pepsi-Cola was originally called 'Brad's Drink' after its inventor Caleb Bradham, a pharmacist from New Bern, North Carolina. It was renamed Pepsi-Cola in 1898.

questions.question: Which frozen cocktail machine was invented by a Dallas 7-Eleven owner in the late 1950s, leading to the Slurpee?
questions.explanation: The ICEE machine was invented by Omar Knedlik in the late 1950s. 7-Eleven licensed the technology and rebranded it as the Slurpee in 1967.

questions.question: What classic 1950s cocktail party drink was made by mixing ginger ale with sherbet in a punch bowl?
questions.explanation: Sherbet punch, made by floating scoops of sherbet in ginger ale, was the quintessential easy party drink of the 1950s and 1960s, found at countless social gatherings.

questions.question: Which drink was known as 'The Champagne of Bottled Beer' starting in the 1940s?
questions.explanation: Miller High Life has used the slogan 'The Champagne of Bottled Beer' since the 1940s, referencing its effervescent quality and the clear glass bottle.

questions.question: What was the name of the cream-based cocktail, popular in the 1960s, made with creme de menthe and creme de cacao?
questions.explanation: The Grasshopper cocktail, with its distinctive green color from creme de menthe, was a beloved after-dinner drink in the 1960s and 1970s.

questions.question: Which iconic children's drink mix featured a smiling pitcher as its mascot, crashing through walls?
questions.explanation: Kool-Aid's mascot, the Kool-Aid Man, was a giant pitcher who would burst through walls shouting 'Oh yeah!' The character debuted in advertising in 1975.

questions.question: What was the name of the popular 1980s wine cooler brand featuring Bruce Willis in its commercials?
questions.explanation: While Bruce Willis appeared in Seagram's Golden Wine Cooler ads, Bartles & Jaymes was the best-known wine cooler brand of the 1980s with its folksy ad campaign.

questions.question: Which cocktail, made famous in the 1960s James Bond films, is made with gin, vodka, and Lillet blanc?
questions.explanation: The Vesper Martini was created by Ian Fleming for James Bond in 'Casino Royale.' Bond famously orders it 'shaken, not stirred.'

questions.question: Which powdered breakfast drink mix claimed to have 'more Vitamin C than orange juice' in its 1970s commercials?
questions.explanation: Tang marketed itself heavily on its vitamin C content in the 1970s, claiming it provided more Vitamin C than orange juice per serving.
